snippet: Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich began their final appeals of 2011 in a G.O.P. presidential contest that remains fluid.
abstract: Republican presidential candidates are making final appeals to Iowa voters as caucus draws near; volatility of race is underscored by latest Des Moines Register poll showing Mitt Romney and Ron Paul essentially tied for the lead with Rick Santorum gaining momentum close behind.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and JIM RUTENBERG
byline.contributor: Katharine Q. Seelye contributed reporting from Hampton, N.H.; Trip Gabriel from Council Bluffs, Iowa; and Susan Saulny from Urbandale, Iowa.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich began their final appeals of 2011 in a G.O.P. presidential contest that remains fluid.

headline.seo: Republicans Scramble as Vote Nears in Iowa
headline.main: Last-Minute Scramble as Caucus Night Nears
headline.print_headline: Last-Minute Scramble As Caucus Night Nears
